A002.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The power supply identified an overtemperature condition on its heatsink and the thermo-switch contact is open.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The power supply is supplying more DC current than required for Brake operation.

Solutions: 1.1 On the power supply, check if the Brake current settings are correct (parameters C000, P128, and P171),

Possible Cause: 1 The power supply identified an overtemperature condition on its heatsink and the thermo-switch contact is open.

Fault Detection: 1.2 The number of brake operation cycles is above the maximum allowed for the assembly (power supply and brake).

Solutions: 1.2 Check the power supply/brake operation frequency; it might be above the allowed value.

Possible Cause: 1 The power supply identified an overtemperature condition on its heatsink and the thermo-switch contact is open.

Fault Detection: 1.3 Ruptured wires or poor contact on the thermo-switch connected to CN22 terminals on the power rectifier control board.

Solutions: 1.3 Replace the power supply if it is not possible to repair the ruptured wires or the poor contact on the switch terminals.
A002.label: Heatsink Overtemperature.

A003.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - The instantaneous (peak) value of the power supply output current (shown in M004) has exceeded 200% of the power supply maximum current.

Fault Detection: 1.1 - Use of an incorrect Brake coil.

Solutions: 1.1 - Check the model of the brake in use and the nominal resistance of its coil. Set the proper parameters (C000, P128 e P171) correctly for the coil in use.

Possible Cause: 1 - The instantaneous (peak) value of the power supply output current (shown in M004) has exceeded 200% of the power supply maximum current.

Fault Detection: 1.2 - Damaged brake coil or too low resistance (incompatible with the nominal values shown on the Brake Manuals).

Solutions: 1.2 - Replace the Brake. Purchase services and repair from Vulkan.

Possible Cause: 1 - The instantaneous (peak) value of the power supply output current (shown in M004) has exceeded 200% of the power supply maximum current.

Fault Detection: 1.3 - Low electrical insulation on the Brake coil.

Solutions: 1.3 - Replace the Brake. Purchase services and repair from Vulkan.

Possible Cause: 1 - The instantaneous (peak) value of the power supply output current (shown in M004) has exceeded 200% of the power supply maximum current.

Fault Detection: 1.4 - The power supply cables between the power supply and the coil are shorted. Low impedance connected to the power supply output.

Solutions: 1.4 - Replace damaged cables on the Brake power supply line.
A003.label: Output Overcurrent.

A006.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - The power line frequency varies more than the max. allowable value, equal to 500 µs between two mains periods.

Fault Detection: 1.1 - Oscillations on the three-phase input of the power supply. Poor contact on the three-phase power supply terminals.

Solutions: 1.1 - Check the conditions of all cables and terminals in your electrical installation, from the source to the three-phase power supply input.

Possible Cause: 1 - The power line frequency varies more than the max. allowable value, equal to 500 µs between two mains periods.

Fault Detection: 1.2 - Frequency fluctuations on the three-phase electrical power line.

Solutions: 1.2 - Check if other electrical loads connected to the same electrical power line as the V317 power supply are affecting the sinusoidal supply for the power supply.

NOTE!
This alarm is inhibited on V317 power supply (C153 = 0); thus, by default, the power supply does not display this fault. Auto-reset of this alarm is also set (C093 = 1).
A006.label: Unstable Mains Frequency.

A007.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - One or more phases on V317 power supply input are faulty.

Fault Detection: 1.1 - Oscillations on the three-phase input of the power supply or phase(s) absent or poor contact on the terminals for three-phase power supply.

Solutions: 1.1 - Check the conditions of all cables and terminals in your electrical installation, from the source to the three-phase power supply input.

NOTE! This alarm is inhibited on V317 power supply (C153 = 0); thus, by default, the power supply does not display this fault. Auto-reset of this alarm is also set (C093 = 1).
A007.label: Grid Power Failure.

A012.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - Frequency (M008– MFreq) of the mains is over 70Hz or under 40Hz.

Fault Detection: 1.1 - The three-phase input for the power supply is at a frequency that is out of the rated range of values.

Solutions: 1.1 - Check if the three-phase power connected to the power supply input is proper for the rated frequency range.

Possible Cause: 1 - Frequency (M008– MFreq) of the mains is over 70Hz or under 40Hz.

Fault Detection: 1.2 - The three-phase supply for the V317 power supply is not from a sinusoidal three-phase supply.

Solutions: 1.2 - Use the three-phase power supply from a proper supply point. Reduce voltage oscillations caused by other non-linear loads.

NOTE!

Auto-reset of this alarm is also set (C093 = 1).
A012.label: Frequency out of Range

A013.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - Failure of the circuits supplying the synchronization signals of the three-phase mains at the V317 power supply.

Fault Detection: 1.1 - Internal boards of the power supply do not identify the phase sequence from the mains.

Solutions: 1.1 - Check the electrical wiring, ensuring that L1, L2, and L3 terminals on the V317 power supply are connected to the R, S, and T phases, respectively. Turn the power supply OFF and ON. Replace the power supply.

NOTE! Auto-reset of this alarm is also set (C093 = 1).
A013.label: No Synchronization

A016.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The mains voltage for V317 power supply exceeded 480 VAC by 15%.

Fault Detection: 1.1 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application

Solutions: 1.1 Fix the three-phase power supply at the converter input.

Possible Cause: 1 The mains voltage for V317 power supply exceeded 480 VAC by 15%.

Fault Detection: 1.2 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application

Solutions: 1.2 Use the three-phase power supply from a proper supply point.

Possible Cause: 1 The mains voltage for V317 power supply exceeded 480 VAC by 15%.

Fault Detection: 1.3 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application

NOTE!
This alarm is inhibited on V317 power supply (C157 = 0); thus, by default, the power supply does not display this fault. Auto-reset of this alarm is also set (C093 = 1).
A016.label: Mains Overvoltage

A017.description:

Fault Detection: 1.1 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application.

Solutions: 1.1 Fix the three-phase power supply at the converter input.

Solutions: 1.2 Use the three-phase power supply from a proper supply point.

Possible Cause: 1 The mains voltage for V317 power supply is below 220 VAC by 15% or more.

Fault Detection: 1.3 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application.

Solutions: 1.3 Fix the voltage instabilities on the three-phase voltage that is connected to the V317 power supply input.

Fault Detection: 1.4 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application

Solutions: 1.4 Check your electrical installation and the conditions and gauges of all cables and terminals in your electrical installation, from the source to the three-phase power supply input.

Fault Detection: 1.1 Measuring the voltage at L1, L2, and L3 power supply input terminals. Monitoring the input voltage on M009 parameter at the KeyPad (MMI), RemoteDrive Software, or VConnect Application

Solutions: 1.1 Check if other electrical loads connected to the same V317 power supply line are affecting the voltage levels for the power supply.

NOTE!
This alarm is inhibited on V317 power supply (C157 = 0); thus, by default, the power supply does not display this fault. Auto-reset of this alarm is also set (C093 = 1).
A017.label: Mains Undervoltage.

A020.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The brake open microswitch (sensor) is not in use, but there is no connection between C1 and C3.

Fault Detection: 1.1 After receiving the Open Brake command (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake closes after the call current time elapses.

Solutions: 1.1 Install a jumper between terminals C1 and C3 if the Brake open microswitch is not in use.

Possible Cause: 2 Power supply current and time settings are insufficient for brake open operation.

Fault Detection: 2.1 After receiving the Open Brake command (terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake starts opening, but immediately closes.

Solutions: 2.1 Check and fix the call current (C000) setting to comply with the characteristics of the installed brake.

Possible Cause: 2 Power supply current and time settings are insufficient for brake open operation.

Fault Detection: 2.2 After receiving the Open Brake command (terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake starts opening, but immediately closes.

Solutions: 2.2 Check and fix the call current time (P171) setting.

Possible Cause: 2 Power supply current and time settings are insufficient for brake open operation.

Fault Detection: 2.3 After receiving the Open Brake command (terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake starts opening, but immediately closes.

Solutions: 2.3 Check and fix the economic current time (P128) setting.

Possible Cause: 2 Power supply current and time settings are insufficient for brake open operation.

Fault Detection: 2.4 After receiving the Open Brake command (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake closes immediately after receiving the brake open command.

Solutions: 2.4 Set P177 parameter to a value that is slightly higher than P171 to ensure that the power supply receives 24 VDC at its C3 terminal (Brake Open signal) before the A020 power supply alarm triggers.

Possible Cause: 3 Excessive gap between pads and disc/pulley or force above the rated value set on the brake.

Fault Detection: 3.1 After receiving the Open Brake command (terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake starts opening, but immediately closes.

Solutions: 3.1 Adjust and ensure that the gaps between brake pads and disc, or between shoes and pulley, are of the rated value.

Possible Cause: 3 Excessive gap between pads and disc/pulley or force above the rated value set on the brake.

Fault Detection: 3.2 After receiving the Open Brake command (terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake starts opening, but immediately closes.

Solutions: 3.2 Check information on the brake manual. These forces are rarely changed. Adjust the force for the design values, if required.

Possible Cause: 3 Excessive gap between pads and disc/pulley or force above the rated value set on the brake.

Fault Detection: 3.3 After receiving the Open Brake command (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake closes after the call current time elapses.

Solutions: 3.3 Make sure that there is no mechanical dust blockage on the air gap between the armature and the brake housing.

Possible Cause: 3 Excessive gap between pads and disc/pulley or force above the rated value set on the brake.

Fault Detection: 3.4 After receiving the Open Brake command (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake closes after the call current time elapses.

Solutions: 3.4 Check information on the brake manual. These forces rarely change. Adjust the force for the design values, if required.

Possible Cause: 4 Signaling fault at the microswitch (Brake Open Sensor).
Fault Detection: 4.1 The microswitch or sensor installed on the Brake fails and interrupts the 24 VDC signal return to C3 terminal on the power supply while the brake is opening (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC) or after being opened.
Solutions: 4.1 Set the brake microswitch.

Possible Cause: 4 Signaling fault at the microswitch (Brake Open Sensor).
Fault Detection: 4.2 The microswitch or sensor installed on the Brake fails and interrupts the 24 VDC signal return to C3 terminal on the power supply while the brake is opening (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC) or after being opened.
Solutions: 4.2 Check if the sensor receives 24 VDC and returns this value to C3 terminal when the brake is open.

Possible Cause: 4 Signaling fault at the microswitch (Brake Open Sensor).
Fault Detection: 4.3 The microswitch or sensor installed on the Brake fails and interrupts the 24 VDC signal return to C3 terminal on the power supply while the brake is opening (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC) or after being opened.
Solutions: 4.3 Check the integrity of cables, connectors and connections between the microswitch and C3 terminal for power supply command.

Possible Cause: 5 Other alarms (A002, A003, A006, A007, A012, A013, A016, and A017), when trigged, are usually overlapped by A020 alarm and the brake does not open or does no close after opening.

Fault Detection: 5.1 After receiving the Open Brake command (terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake starts opening, but immediately closes.

Solutions: 5.1 Install a temporary jumper between C1 and C3 terminals to prevent A020 alarm from occurring. (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), check the precedence of other alarms, Follow the steps in this chapter for faults/alarms (A002, A003, A006, A007, A012, A013, A016, and A017) and fix properly. After finding the solution, remove this jumper and restore the installation to the original state.

Possible Cause: 5 Other alarms (A002, A003, A006, A007, A012, A013, A016, and A017), when trigged, are usually overlapped by A020 alarm and the brake does not open or does no close after opening.

Fault Detection: 5.2 After receiving the Open Brake command (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), the brake closes immediately after receiving the brake open command.

Solutions: 5.2 Install a temporary jumper between C1 and C3 terminals to prevent A020 alarm from occurring. (Terminal C2 = 24 VDC), check the precedence of other alarms, Follow the steps in this chapter for faults/alarms (A002, A003, A006, A007, A012, A013, A016, and A017) and fix properly. After finding the solution, remove this jumper and restore the installation to the original state.

NOTE!
In some cases, for a better fault detection, it might be required to disconnect the signal from the sensor//microswitch from the power supply and connect C1 and C3 terminals to prevent A020 alarm, making easier to check other parameters or settings of the brake or its sensor/microswitch. After solving the fault, restore the original wiring.
A020.label: External Fault 1 (Brake Opening Fault).

A021.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The number of power supply actuations per hour or minute has been exceeded and the brake coil may be overheated.
Fault Detection: 1.1 The brake remains closed and does not open after a sequence of operations.
Solutions: 1.1 Wait for a while. Turn OFF and ON the power supply.

Possible Cause: 1 The number of power supply actuations per hour or minute has been exceeded and the brake coil may be overheated.
Fault Detection: 1.2 The brake remains closed and does not open after a sequence of operations.
Solutions: 1.2 The value for the current constant set for this alarm is too low. Increase C001 parameter setting.

Possible Cause: 1 The number of power supply actuations per hour or minute has been exceeded and the brake coil may be overheated.
Fault Detection: 1.3 The brake remains closed and does not open after a sequence of operations.
Solutions: 1.3 The value for the time constant set for this alarm is too low. Increase C002 parameter setting.

Possible Cause: 1 The number of power supply actuations per hour or minute has been exceeded and the brake coil may be overheated.
Fault Detection: 1.4 The brake remains closed and does not open after a sequence of operations.
Solutions: 1.4 Decrease the number of actuations/hour or actuations/minute between the power supply and brakes.

Possible Cause: 1 The number of power supply actuations per hour or minute has been exceeded and the brake coil may be overheated.
Fault Detection: 1.5 The brake remains closed and does not open after a sequence of operations.
Solutions: 1.5 Disable the alarm, setting C002 to 0.

NOTE!
This alarm is usually inhibited on V317 power supply (C002 = 0); thus, by default, the power supply does not display this fault.
You can enable this monitoring/alarm by setting:
a) Parameter C001 = % average current value (calculated based on inactive time + active time of the power supply and respective recovery and economic currents).
b) Parameter C002 = estimated time for an overheating fault of the brake coil.
A021.label: Brake I2t Trip.

A024.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The EEPROM on the motherboard is missing or blank.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The power supply stops working and does not command the brake opening.

Solutions: 1.1 Replace the power supply.
A024.label: EEPROM Missing or Blank.

A025.description:
Possible Cause: 1 Part of the content of the EEPROM work area has changed.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. A025 Alarm is displayed because parts of the data contents in the EEPROM work area have changed. After acknowledgement, this alarm must be reset. Then, as a consequence, a W006 or W008 Warning will be displayed.

Solutions: 1.1 Reset this Alarm sending a 24 VDC pulse by closing a contact between C1 and C5 terminals, located on the V317 Power Supply. See the descriptions for W006 and W008 warnings; there you find the procedures to be followed when they occur. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.

Veja também o capítulo Cópia de Parâmetros (Parameter copy).
A025.label: Wrong parameters in the EEPROM work area.

A026.description:
Possible Cause: 1 Part of the content of the EEPROM work area has changed.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. A026 Alarm is displayed because parts of the data contents in the EEPROM backup area have changed. Reset this alarm soon after acknowledgement. Then, as a consequence, a W007 or W009 Warning will be displayed.

Solutions: 1.1 Reset this Alarm sending a 24 VDC pulse by closing a contact between C1 and C5 terminals, located on the V317 Power Supply. See the descriptions for W007 and W009 warnings; there you find the procedures to be followed when they occur. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.
A026.label: Parameter errors in the EEPROM backup area

A029.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The pad wear detection relay (CDPG) is not in use.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The brake stays closed and does not open, but the brake pads are in proper conditions for use.

Solutions: 1.1 Install a jumper between C1 and C4 terminals.

Possible Cause: 2The pad wear detection relay (CDPG) signals that the brake pads are worn.

Fault Detection: 2.1 The worn brake pads and its sensors signal that it is time for replacement.

Solutions: 2.2 Replace brake pads and reset the CFPG relay.

Possible Cause: 3 The pad wear detection relay (CDPG) installed is not powered, has an active alarm, or is damaged.

Fault Detection: 3.1 The brake stays closed and does not open, but the brake pads are in proper conditions for use.

Solutions: 3.1 Follow troubleshooting steps for the pad wear detection relay (CDPG). If required, replace the CDPG.
A029.label: External Fault 2 (Replace Brake Pads).

A031.description:
Possible Cause: 1 Internal EEPROM fault.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The power supply stops working and does not control brake opening. This occurs when the Power Supply is turned ON and the user cannot access the data in the EEPROM work area, and the data have changed. This alarm cannot be reset. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.

Solutions: 1.1 Replace V317 Power Supply.
A031.label: Data changes in the EEPROM Work Area

A032.description:
Possible Cause: 1 The microcontroller might have been restarted due to an electromagnetic disturbance.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The power supply stops working and does not control brake opening.

Solutions: 1.1 Turn the power supply OFF and ON.

Possible Cause: 1 The microcontroller might have been restarted due to an electromagnetic disturbance.

Fault Detection: 1.2 The power supply stops working and does not control brake opening.

Solutions: 1.2 Replace the power supply.
A032.label: Microcontroller restarted

A033.description:
Possible Cause: 1 Exceptionally, other faults and causes.

Fault Detection: 1.1 The power supply stops working and does not control brake opening.

Solutions: 1.1 Replace the power supply.

NOTE!
Whenever a trigged alarm is not described in this section, contact Vulkan Technical Assistance, as informed on Section 1.8, in this manual.
A033.label: Other faults.

W004.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - A safety setting is disabling the CC current output of the V317 Power Supply, preventing the brake from opening.

Fault Detection: 1.1 - The open brake command remains active (C2 terminal = 24 VDC) during an energization event or a re-energization of V317 Power Supply.

Solutions: 1.1 - Ensure that the open brake command is disabled by opening the contact between C1 and C2 (C2 terminal = 0 VDC) before energizing or re-energizing V317 Power Supply. Send an open brake command by closing the contact between C1 and C2 (or C2 = 24 VDC) only after energizing or re-energizing the power supply. Also ensure that there is no other active alarm.

Possible Cause: 1 - A safety setting is disabling the CC current output of the V317 Power Supply, preventing the brake from opening.

Fault Detection: 1.2- The open brake command remains active (C2 terminal = 24 VDC) after an alarm event and/or after a reset pulse (between C1 and C5 terminals).

Solutions: 1.2 - Ensure that the open brake command is disabled by opening the contact between C1 and C2 (C2 terminal = 0 VDC) before energizing or re-energizing V317 Power Supply. Send an open brake command by closing the contact between C1 and C2 (or C2 = 24 VDC) only after clearing the alarm condition and resetting the alarm.
W004.label: Safe restart after energization, or Alarm on V317 Power Supply

W006.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - This warning can be trigged (displayed) after resetting an A025 alarm (EEPROM work area fault).

Fault Detection: 1.1 - The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. V317 power supply keeps displaying the Warning, and this means that the parameter backup values have just been loaded into RAM memory. User attention is required for correcting the parameters in the EEPROM work area.

Solutions: 1.1 - If you are sure that you already made a backup copy of the defined parameters before this alarm was trigged: Define P002 = 3: Backup Restore. Make sure that EEPROM work and backup areas have the same contents, defining P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.

Possible Cause: 2 - This warning can be trigged (displayed) after resetting an A025 alarm (EEPROM work area fault).

Fault Detection: 2.2 - The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. V317 power supply keeps displaying the Warning, and this means that the parameter backup values have just been loaded into RAM memory. User attention is required for correcting the parameters in the EEPROM work area.

Solutions: 2.2 - If you are not sure about having made a backup copy of the defined parameters before this alarm was trigged: Define P002 = 1: DefaultRestore do restore the Factory defaults. Then make the proper parameter settings for your Brake. Then make sure that EEPROM work and backup areas have the same contents, defining P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.
W006.label: Backup values stored in RAM.

W007.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - This W007 warning can be trigged (displayed) after resetting an A026 alarm (EEPROM backup area fault).

Fault Detection: 1.1 - The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. The Power Supply keeps displaying the Warning, and this means that the default parameters have just been loaded into RAM memory. User attention is required for redefining the work parameters and storing them in the EEPROM work and backup areas.

Solutions: 1.1 - We recommend that you overwrite the EEPROM work area with the factory defaults. Execute P002 command, defining P002 = 1: DefaultRestore. Then redefine the parameters for the connected Brake. Then make sure that EEPROM work and backup areas have the same contents, defining P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.
W007.label: Default values stored in RAM.

W008.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - This W008 warning can be trigged (displayed) after resetting an A025 alarm (EEPROM work area fault).

Fault Detection: 1.1 - The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. V317 power supply keeps displaying this Warning, and this means a fault while copying the work area into the EEPROM work area due to changes of the values in the work area. User attention is required for correcting the parameters in the EEPROM work area.

Solutions: 1.1 - We recommend that you overwrite the EEPROM work area with the factory defaults. Execute P002 command, defining P002 = 1: DefaultRestore. Then redefine the parameters for the connected Brake. Then make sure that EEPROM work and backup areas have the same contents, defining P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.
W008.label: Wrong parameters in the EEPROM work area

W009.description:
Possible Cause: 1 - This W009 warning can be trigged (displayed) after resetting an A026 alarm (EEPROM backup area fault).

Fault Detection: 1.1 - The brake remains closed and does not open because the power supply has an active alarm or warning. The power supply keeps displaying this Warning, and this means a fault while copying the work area into the EEPROM work area due to changes of the values in the work area. User attention is required for redefining the work parameters and storing them in the EEPROM work and backup areas

Solutions: 1.1 - We recommend that you overwrite the EEPROM work area with the factory defaults. Execute P002 command, defining P002 = 1: DefaultRestore. Then redefine the parameters for the connected Brake. Then make sure that EEPROM work and backup areas have the same contents, defining P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. See also “Parameter Copy” chapter.
W009.label: Parameter error in the EEPROM work area

A002.description:
Causa: 1 El convertidor identificó sobre temperatura en su disipador de calor y su interruptor térmico está con el contacto abierto.

Detección de Falla: 1.1 El convertidor está suministrando más corriente DC que la necesaria para la operación del Freno.

Soluciones: 1.1 Verificar en el convertidor, si la programación de corrientes del Freno está correcta (parámetros C000, P128 y P171).

Causa: 1 El convertidor identificó sobre temperatura en su disipador de calor y su interruptor térmico está con el contacto abierto.

Detección de Falla: 1.2 La cantidad de operaciones del freno está por sobre el máximo permitido para el conjunto (convertidor y freno).

Soluciones: 1.2 Controlar la frecuencia de maniobras del convertidor / Frenos que puede estar por encima de lo permitido.

Causa: 1 El convertidor identificó sobre temperatura en su disipador de calor y su interruptor térmico está con el contacto abierto.

Detección de Falla: 1.3 Cables rotos o mal contacto en el interruptor térmico conectado a las terminales CN22 de la placa de control del rectificador de potencia.

Soluciones: 1.3 Sustituir el convertidor si no fuera posible reparar los cables rotos o el mal contacto en las terminales del interruptor.
A002.label: Sobre Temperatura en el disipador de calor.

A003.description:
Causa: 1 - El valor instantáneo (de pico) de la corriente de salida del convertidor (observado en M004) ha excedido el 200% de la corriente máxima del convertidor.

Detección de Falla: 1.1 - Utilización de bobina de Freno equivocada.

Soluciones : 1.1 - dentificar el freno utilizado y la resistencia nominal de su bobina. Configurar parámetros (C000, P128 y P171) adecuados a la operación de la bobina utilizada.

Causa: 1 - El valor instantáneo (de pico) de la corriente de salida del convertidor (observado en M004) ha excedido el 200% de la corriente máxima del convertidor.

Detección de Falla: 1.2 - Bobina del freno averiada o resistencia eléctrica muy baja (incompatible con valores nominales indicado en los manuales del freno).

Soluciones : 1.2 - Sustituir el Freno. Comprar el reparo de Vulkan.

Causa: 2 - El valor instantáneo (de pico) de la corriente de salida del convertidor (observado en M004) ha excedido el 200% de la corriente máxima del convertidor.

Detección de Falla: 2.1 - Bajo aislamiento eléctrico en la bobina del Freno.

Soluciones : 2.1 - Sustituir el Freno. Comprar el reparo de Vulkan.

Causa: 2 - El valor instantáneo (de pico) de la corriente de salida del convertidor (observado en M004) ha excedido el 200% de la corriente máxima del convertidor.

Detección de Falla: 2.2 - Cables de alimentación entre convertidor y bobina en cortocircuito. Baja impedancia conectada a la salida del convertidor.

Soluciones : 2.2 - Sustituir los cables averiados que están alimentando a la bobina del Freno.
A003.label: Sobre corriente de salida

A006.description:

O Alarme A026 está sendo mostrado devido a alteração em partes do conteúdo dos dados na Área de Backup da EEPROM. Este alarme deve ser resetado (cancelado) logo após seu reconhecimento. Como consequência do reset, uma advertência W007 ou W009 será mostrada.

Solução: 1.1 Faça o reset deste Alarme com um pulso de 24Vcc, fechando um contato entre o borne C1 e o borne C5, localizados no conversor V317. Consulte o descritivo das advertências W007 e W009 onde é explicado como proceder caso ocorram. Veja também o capítulo Cópia de Parâmetros (Parameter copy).
A026.label: EEPROM com erro de parâmetros na cópia de segurança

A029.description:
Causa: 1 O Relé de detecção de desgaste de pastilhas (CDPG) não está sendo utilizado.

Defeito: 1.1 Freio permanece fechado e não abre, porém as pastilhas do Freio estão em condições de utilização.

Solução: 1.1 Fazer uma ligação (jump) entre os bornes C1 e C4.

Causa: 2O Relé de detecção de desgaste de pastilhas (CDPG) indica desgaste de pastilhas do Freio

Defeito: 2.1 As pastilhas do Freio desgastadas e seus sensores indicaram que é momento para substituição.

Solução: 2.2 Substituir as pastilhas do Freio e realizar o reset do relé CDPG.

Causa: 3 O Relé de detecção de desgaste de pastilhas (CDPG) instalado não está alimentado ou está com seu alarme ativo ou está danificado.

Defeito: 3.1 Freio permanece fechado e não abre, porém as pastilhas do Freio estão em condições de utilização.

Solução: 3.1 Resolver falhas relacionadas ao relé de detecção de desgaste de pastilhas (CDPG). Substituir o CDPG se necessário.
A029.label: Falha externa 2 (Substituir Pastilhas do Freio).

A031.description:
Causa: 1 O Falha interna na EEPROM.

Defeito: 1.1 O Conversor deixa de operar e não realiza o comando de abertura do Freio. Ocorre quando o Conversor é ligado e os dados contidos na área de trabalho da EEPROM não estão acessíveis para o usuário e estão alterados. Este alarme não possui reset. Veja também o capítulo Cópia de Parâmetros (Parameter copy).

Solução: 1.1 Substitua o conversor V317.
A031.label: dados internos da área de trabalho da EEPROM alterados

Defeito: 1.1 O Conversor deixa de operar e realizar o comando de abertura do Freio.

Solução: 1.1 Desligar e ligar o conversor.

Causa: 1 O microcontrolador pode ter sido reiniciado devido a uma perturbação eletromagnética.

Defeito: 1.2 O Conversor deixa de operar e realizar o comando de abertura do Freio.

Solução: 1.2 Substituir o conversor.

A033.description:

Defeito: 1.1 O Conversor deixa de operar e realizar o comando de abertura do Freio.

Solução: 1.1 Substituir o conversor.

W004.description:
Causa: 1 - Uma configuração de segurança está desabilitando a saída de corrente DC no conversor V317 e está impedindo a abertura do freio.

Defeito: 1.1 - O comando de abrir Freio permanece ativado (Borne C2 = 24Vcc) durante um evento de energização ou reenergização do conversor V317.

Solução: 1.1 - Garantir a desativação do comando de abrir Freio, abrindo o contato entre C1 e C2 (Borne C2 = 0Vcc) antes da energização ou reenergização do conversor V317. Comandar a abertura do freio, fechando o contato entre C1 e C2 (ou C2 = 24Vcc) somente após energizar ou reenergizar o conversor, garantindo também que não há nenhum outro alarme.

W006.description:
Causa: 1 - Esta advertência W006 pode ser disparada (mostrada) após cancelamento (reset) de um alarme A025 (falha na Área de Trabalho da EEPROM).

Defeito: 1.1 - O Freio permanece fechado e não abre porque o conversor está em alarme ou advertência. O conversor V317 permanece em Advertência indicando que os valores dos parâmetros de backup acabaram de ser carregados na memória RAM. Requer atenção do usuário para correção dos parâmetros da área de trabalho da EEPROM.

Solução: 1.1 - Se você tiver certeza de que já realizou um backup dos parâmetros configurados, anteriormente a este alarme: Execute o parâmetro P002 = 3: Backup Restore. Garanta que as áreas de Trabalho e Backup da EEPROM possuem os mesmos dados executando o parâmetro P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. Veja também o capítulo Cópia de Parâmetros (Parameter copy).

Causa: 2 - Esta advertência W006 pode ser disparada (mostrada) após cancelamento (reset) de um alarme A025 (falha na Área de Trabalho da EEPROM).

Defeito: 2.2 - O Freio permanece fechado e não abre porque o conversor está em alarme ou advertência. O conversor V317 permanece em Advertência indicando que os valores dos parâmetros de backup acabaram de ser carregados na memória RAM. Requer atenção do usuário para correção dos parâmetros da área de trabalho da EEPROM.

Solução: 2.2 - Se você não tiver certeza ou não realizou um backup dos parâmetros configurados, anteriormente a este alarme: Execute o parâmetro P002 = 1: DefaultRestore para restaurar parâmetros de Fábrica. Em seguida realize novamente a configuração dos parâmetros corretos para o seu Freio. Logo a seguir, garanta que as áreas de Trabalho e Backup da EEPROM possuem os mesmos dados executando o parâmetro P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup. Veja também o capítulo Cópia de Parâmetros (Parameter copy).
W006.label: Valores do backup armazenados na RAM

W007.description:
Causa: 1 - Esta advertência W007 pode ser disparada (mostrada) após cancelamento (reset) de um alarme A026 (falha na área de Backup da EEPROM).

Defeito: 1.1 - O Freio permanece fechado e não abre porque o conversor está em alarme ou advertência. O Conversor permanece em Advertência indicando que os parâmetros predefinidos (default) acabaram de ser carregados na memória RAM. Requer atenção do usuário para refazer a configuração dos parâmetros de trabalho além de armazená-los nas áreas de trabalho e backup da EEPROM.

Solução: 1.1 - Recomendamos reescrever a área de trabalho da EEPROM com os dados de fábrica (Default). Execute o comando P002 selecionando P002 = 1: DefaultRestore. Em seguida refaça a configuração dos parâmetros para o Freio conectado. Logo a seguir, garanta que às áreas de trabalho e de Backup possuam os mesmos dados ao executar o comando P002 = 2:WorkAreaBackup.
W007.label: Valores predefinidos armazenados na RAM
